message.content:
Subject: Resignation from [Your Company Name] - Effective Date

Dear [Boss's Name],

I hope this email finds you well. It is with a heavy heart, but also a sense of professional fulfillment that I write to inform you of my decision to resign from my position at [Company Name]. My last day at the company will be [Date], ensuring a smooth transition for the team and any ongoing projects.

Over the time spent here, I have gained an immense amount of knowledge, skills, and experiences that have significantly contributed to my growth both professionally and personally. It's been a privilege to work alongside such a talented and dedicated group, and I am grateful for the guidance and support provided by you and the rest of the management team.

In preparation for my departure, I will wrap up all active projects and ensure that all my responsibilities are handed over to my designated successor(s). I have already started working on documenting key processes and sharing my knowledge with my colleagues to minimize any disruption during this transition period.

Before I go, I would like to express my gratitude for the opportunities I've had, the friendships forged, and the lessons learned. I am confident that our shared legacy will continue to benefit the company as it moves forward.

Please accept my appreciation for your understanding during this time. If there's anything specific or sensitive that requires attention in my absence, please don't hesitate to reach out. I am more than willing to assist in any way possible until the transition is complete.

I look forward to maintaining a positive working relationship post-resignation and wish [Company Name] continued success in all its endeavors.

Thank you once again for your support throughout my tenure here. I am excited about the future but also saddened by the end of this chapter.

Best regards,

[Your Full Name]
[Your Position]
[Email Address]
[Phone Number]
